title: Drawing, "Design for a Wall Panel with Fireplace", 1745
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and light violet wash, graphite on white laid paper, ruled border in pen and black ink
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, on verso, (probably by Léon Decloux): Cuvilliés
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Wall elevation featuring fireplace with overmantel and cove above, all in the Rococo style.  C- and S-curves abound on every section of the ornament.  In the center of the overmantel one finds a representation of a pastoral scene framed by feathery plant ornament with raffle leaves that curve over central field and onto the chimney panel.  Some of the plant ornament extends past the entablature and into the area of the cove.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Wall Panel with Fireplace", 1745.
1745. Pen and black ink, brush and gray and light violet wash, graphite on white laid paper, ruled border in pen and black ink. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-36.
